thread.title: Andy Sullivan on course for Portugal Masters triumph
thread.title_full: Andy Sullivan on course for Portugal Masters triumph

title: Andy Sullivan on course for Portugal Masters triumph
text:
Andy Sullivan on course for Portugal Masters triumph 18 Oct 2015 11:31:57 
comments 
England's Andy Sullivan remained in a commanding position as he looked to become the first three-time winner on the European Tour this season in the Portugal Masters. 
Sullivan, who won twice in South Africa earlier this year, took a five-shot lead into the final round at Vilamoura and found himself seven clear with nine to play thanks to a front nine of 33. 
The 29-year-old opened with three pars before holing from 25 feet for a birdie on the fourth and two-putting for another on the par-five fifth to reach 20 under par. 
Spain's Eduardo de la Riva briefly closed to within six shots of playing partner Sullivan when he recovered from a bogey on the third with birdies on the fifth and seventh, only to drop a shot on the ninth after finding heavy rough off the tee. 
That left De La Riva in joint second with South African Trevor Fisher on 13 under par, with England's Chris Wood a shot further back. 
The start of play had been delayed by two hours due to heavy overnight rain and the threat of lightning this morning, with a shotgun start used for the second day running in an attempt to complete play before any further bad weather. Related Sport News
